column4: So For my Intel 386 Machine this link http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/pool/multiverse/s/sun-java5/sun-java5-bin_1.5.0-10-1_i386.deb is appropriate for me
why don't you just use APT?
cstextiles use packages.ubuntu.com, it will list dependencies too.  YOu'll need those as well
this site may be helpful http://ljl.byethost14.com/apt
did you try the site I gave you?  A package installed by default is a dependency of ubuntu-desktop
did you enter "ubuntu-desktop" as your meta package?
this list after entering ubuntu-desktop package gives me a list of only thos packages which are to be installed? Am I correct
yes, in theory though the site is pretty new
It shows that I also require odbcinst1debian1 Package and so I think there may be some bugs as that package is not listed in ubuntu Packages Dependency list
unixodbc is though and that depends on odbcinst1debian1
Ya but unixodbc is not listed in the depency list of http://packages.ubuntu.com/edgy/libs/sun-java5-jre
my suggestion is, "try it" :)  If it works, great.  If not, then you have to do a bit more work
I don't know if this is what you want, but have you looked into sabayon?
